mnemonic: TRABALHO = tra-BA-lyo - TRAvel to BALance your work!
cultural_note: Portuguese work culture includes long lunch breaks - 'almoço' is important!
Portuguese doctors are well-respected - public health system 'SNS'!
Many Portuguese doctors are women - medicine is popular field!

mnemonic: PROFESSOR = pro-fe-SOR - same as English professor!
grammar_notes: Masculine. Used for teachers and professors.
cultural_note: Teachers are respected in Portugal - 'Dia do Professor' is October 5!
Most primary school teachers in Portugal are women - 'professoras'!
Law is a prestigious profession in Portugal - many politicians are 'advogados'!
Women lawyers are increasingly common in Portugal's legal profession!
Portuguese universities date to 1290 - Coimbra is one of oldest in Europe!
'Empregado de mesa' specifically means waiter - common in restaurants!

grammar_notes: Feminine. Can mean waitress or domestic worker.
cultural_note: 'Empregada doméstica' means housekeeper - common in Portuguese households.
Engineering is prestigious in Portugal - 'engenheiro' is title of respect!
Women in STEM growing in Portugal - more 'engenheiras' every year!
